items.title: Q&A: New tech helps Parkinson's patients who have trouble walking

items.title: Tylenol during pregnancy: No strong evidence ties use to autism or ADHD risk
items.description: Existing evidence does not clearly link paracetamol (acetaminophen) use during pregnancy with autism or ADHD in children, finds an in-depth evidence r...

items.title: Hospital patients who feel short of breath after being admitted are six times more likely to die, research finds
items.description: The risk of dying is six times higher among patients who become short of breath after being admitted to hospital, according to research published in E...

items.title: Eczema symptoms unchanged by daily or weekly bathing, study shows
items.description: A study has found that people with eczema are able to bathe either daily or weekly, without any impact on their symptoms.

items.title: Should kids be screened for high cholesterol genes? Study weighs costs and benefits
items.description: In the United States, 1 in every 250 people has inherited a genetic variant that leads to dangerously high cholesterol levels from birth.
